txt.en: Mézto can be found at Drenghól in the War of Three Peaks.\n\nYou have done as Mézto asked and sown division between the forces at Bagûd-mekhem. You should report your success to Mézto.
Cold-whelplings can be found at Bagûd-mekhem.\n\nMézto has asked you to slay cold-whelplings in Bagûd-mekhem and set their remains upon fires tended by the Orcs of Gundabad.
Collect the remains of cold-whelplings at Bagûd-mekhem ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Fire-pits can be found at Bagûd-mekhem.\n\nMézto has asked to slay cold-whelplings in Bagûd-mekhem and set their remains upon fires tended by the Orcs of Gundabad.
Collected the remains of cold-whelplings at Bagûd-mekhem ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Cook' cold-whelpling remains in fire-pits at Bagûd-mekhem ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Cooked' cold-whelpling remains in fire-pits at Bagûd-mekhem ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'Ah, [placeholder]!

'You and I both know there is no love lost between the Orcs of Gundabad and those wild Orcs of the Frost-horde. Why should we not turn their mutual distrust to our advantage?

'I have heard that several cold-whelplings have begun to roost with their Orkish allies in Bagûd-mekhem. I do not know the appetites of Orcs, but perhaps if a few of these whelplings were \qcooked\q by Gorgar's Orcs... things might not seem so friendly between them and the Frost-horde.

'Do you understand? Slay as many cold-whelplings as you can and toss them in the fire-pits tended by Gorgar's Orcs!'
Eager to erode the alliance between the forces of Gorgar the Ruthless and Hrímil Frost-heart, Mézto has devised a plan to turn Orc against Orc.

'Hah! It would be quite a joy to see the face of the first Orc who discovers what we've done!

'Alas, my imagination will have to suffice....

'You've done well. That is all, [placeholder].'
